body: Added `/cmake-build-*` to ignore directories created by CLion IDE for cmake builds: - `/cmake-build-debug` - `/cmake-build-release` - ... --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/435)

comment_regular_data.body: --- Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/435#-:-KaXftxrzvY6KHP65SAz:b-jbsf8z)*

I don't think it's the right thing to add every build directory of every IDE to the `.gitignore` of this repo.

---

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks failed.

---



*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/435#-:-Kai9tlOFMpJrUVrf7u4:b-2iiwll)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->
@sudden6 in general I agree with you but this .gitignore contains even Thumbs.db and DStore files so I don't think my change does any harm here :)
yeah, but I think all the IDEs provide an easy way to move the build folder out of the repository, which is IMO always a good idea.
I don't feel strongly about this. This PR needs another reviewer anyway.

Creating a [global .gitignore](https://help.github.com/articles/ignoring-files/#create-a-global-gitignore) is also a nice way of solving this problem. That said, our .gitignore is a mess and we [already](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/master/.gitignore#L66) have IDE-specific things in there.
Since I also don't feel very strong about it and it seems everybody else wants it this way. I'll lgtm

--- Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks failed. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/435#-:-KaqVnRwSusJusiX-X02:b-jbsf8z)*

@cebe if you'd like to have this change merged, please rebase (and enable the checkbox that allows me to rebase it again if necessary). If you feel that a global .gitignore addresses your use case and you don't need to merge this into the repository, close the PR.
too much debate on minor things, don't have the time to deal with this, sry.

commit.message:
added CLion cmake build directory to .gitignore

Added `/cmake-build-*` to ignore directories created
by CLion IDE for cmake builds:

- `/cmake-build-debug`
- `/cmake-build-release`
- ...
